alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 23 at 2:24AM CDT until April 23 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Phillips County in north central Kansas... Southern Phelps County in south central Nebraska... Southeastern Gosper County in south central Nebraska... Eastern Furnas County in south central Nebraska... Harlan County in south central Nebraska... * Until 300 AM CDT. * At 223 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Edison to 8 miles northwest of Almena to near Edmond, moving northeast at 80 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Beaver City, Stamford and Hollinger around 235 AM CDT. Oxford, Bertrand and Prairie View around 240 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Long Island, Atlanta, Woodruff, Holdrege, Alma, Orleans, Loomis and Huntley. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
